item.title: Eagleman Training February
item.author: youremail@domain.com (Some Person)
item.description:
Hereâ€™s a weekly summary of your February workouts for your 70.3 Half Ironman training. You can assign these workouts to specific days based on your schedule, but aim to balance swim, bike, run, and strength training throughout the week.

February Training Plan (Build Phase) ğŸŠâ€â™‚ï¸ğŸš´â€â™‚ï¸ğŸƒâ€â™‚ï¸

Focus: Build foundational fitness, improve technique, and establish consistency.

Week 1

  1. Swim: 1,500 meters

    • Warm-up: 300m easy
    • Main set: 4x200m moderate pace (20s rest), 4x100m race pace (15s rest)
    • Cool-down: 200m easy

  2. Bike: 40 km

item.title: Eagleman Training March
item.author: youremail@domain.com (Some Person)
item.description:
March Training Plan (Build Phase)ğŸŠâ€â™‚ï¸ğŸš´â€â™‚ï¸ğŸƒâ€â™‚ï¸

Focus: Increase volume and intensity, introduce more race-specific workouts.

Weekly Structure

  1. Swim: 2â€“3 sessions (2,500â€“3,500 meters per session)
    • Include intervals at race pace, open-water simulations, and technique drills.
  2. Bike: 2â€“3 sessions (2â€“4 hours per week)
    • Include long rides, hill repeats, and tempo efforts.
  3. Run: 2â€“3 sessions (1â€“2 hours per week)
    • Include long runs, tempo runs, and brick workouts.
  4. Strength Training: 1â€“2 sessions (45â€“60 minutes)
  5. Recovery: 1â€“2 easy days or rest days per week.

Key Workouts

  • Long Bike: Build up to 3â€“4 hours with steady Zone 2 effort.
  • Brick Workouts: Bike 2â€“3 hours followed by a 20â€“40 minute run at race pace.
  • Long Run: Build up to 90â€“120 minutes at an easy pace.
  • Swim Intervals: Include 10x100m at race pace with short rest (10â€“15 seconds).

Week 1

  1. Swim: 2,500 meters

item.title: Eagleman Training April
item.author: youremail@domain.com (Some Person)
item.description:
April Training Plan (Peak Phase) ğŸŠâ€â™‚ï¸ğŸš´â€â™‚ï¸ğŸƒâ€â™‚ï¸

Focus: Maximize race-specific fitness, practice pacing, and fine-tune nutrition.

Weekly Structure

  1. Swim: 2â€“3 sessions (3,000â€“4,000 meters per session)
    • Include race-pace intervals, open-water simulations, and endurance sets.
  2. Bike: 2â€“3 sessions (3â€“5 hours per week)
    • Include long rides, race-pace efforts, and hill repeats.
  3. Run: 2â€“3 sessions (1.5â€“2.5 hours per week)
    • Include long runs, tempo runs, and brick workouts.
  4. Strength Training: 1 session (45 minutes)
  5. Recovery: 1â€“2 easy days or rest days per week.

Key Workouts

  • Long Bike: Build up to 4â€“5 hours with race-pace efforts.
  • Brick Workouts: Bike 3â€“4 hours followed by a 30â€“50 minute run at race pace.
  • Long Run: Build up to 2â€“2.5 hours at an easy pace.
  • Swim Intervals: Include 12x100m at race pace with short rest (10 seconds).

Key Notes

  • Nutrition: Practice your race-day nutrition strategy during long workouts.
  • Recovery: Listen to your body and adjust the plan as needed.
  • Race Simulation: In April and May, do a full race simulation (swim-bike-run) to test your pacing and nutrition.

Week 1

  1. Swim: 3,000 meters

item.title: Eagleman Training May
item.author: youremail@domain.com (Some Person)
item.description:
May Training Plan (Taper Phase)ğŸŠâ€â™‚ï¸ğŸš´â€â™‚ï¸ğŸƒâ€â™‚ï¸

Focus: Reduce volume, maintain intensity, and focus on recovery and race preparation.

Weekly Structure

  1. Swim: 2 sessions (2,000â€“3,000 meters per session)
    • Include race-pace intervals and open-water simulations.
  2. Bike: 2 sessions (2â€“3 hours per week)
    • Include shorter rides with race-pace efforts.
  3. Run: 2 sessions (1â€“1.5 hours per week)
    • Include tempo runs and short brick workouts.
  4. Strength Training: 1 session (30â€“45 minutes, light)
  5. Recovery: 2â€“3 easy days or rest days per week.

Key Workouts

  • Long Bike: Reduce to 2â€“3 hours with race-pace efforts.
  • Brick Workouts: Bike 1.5â€“2 hours followed by a 20â€“30 minute run at race pace.
  • Long Run: Reduce to 60â€“90 minutes at an easy pace.
  • Swim Intervals: Include 8x100m at race pace with short rest (10 seconds).

Week 1 (May 1â€“7)

  1. Swim: 2,500 meters

item.title: Eagleman Training Race Week
item.author: youremail@domain.com (Some Person)
item.description:
Race Week (June 1â€“7, 2025) ğŸŠâ€â™‚ï¸ğŸš´â€â™‚ï¸ğŸƒâ€â™‚ï¸

Focus: Rest, recover, and prepare for race day.

Race Week (June 1â€“7, 2025)

  1. Swim: 1,500 meters

    • Easy technique-focused swim with a few race-pace efforts.

  2. Bike: 20 km

    • Easy spin with 2x5 minutes at race pace.

  3. Run: 5 km

    • Easy run with 2x3 minutes at race pace.

  4. Swim: 1,000 meters

    • Easy swim with 4x100m at race pace.

  5. Bike: 15 km

    • Easy spin with 2x3 minutes at race pace.
    • Brick Run: 1 km easy off the bike.

  6. Race Day!
